Rule.definition: a prescribed guide for conduct or action b
Rule.origin: [a directing the district court to show cause why its ruling should not be vacated " People v. District Court , 797 P.2d 1259 (1990)"]

1 a.definition: a prescribed guide for conduct or action

2 a.definition: an order or directive issued by a court in a particular proceeding esp. upon petition of a party to the proceeding that commands an officer or party to perform an act or show cause why an act should not be performed [a directing the district court to show cause why its ruling should not be vacated ", 797 P.2d 1259 (1990)"]

sub_terms.b: a usually judicially promulgated regulation having the force of law that governs judicial practice or procedure [of evidence] [of appellate procedure] see also

3.definition: all or part of a statement (as a regulation) by an administrative agency that has general or particular applicability and future effect and that is designed to implement, interpret, or prescribe law or policy or that describes the organization, procedure, or practice of the agency itself [a subject to statutory notice and comment requirements for informal rulemaking]

4 a.definition: a regulation or bylaw governing procedure or conduct in a body, organization, institution, or proceeding

sub_terms.b: a resolution of a legislative rules committee setting forth the terms for consideration of a particular bill by the entire body

5.definition: the exercise of authority or control [majority ] see also,vb

2.definition: to lay down a rule or ruling [in favor of the plaintiff]
